        Description copied from class: FacetSearchModel

      • byRange

        public FacetExpression<T> byRange(FacetRange<V> range)
        Generates an expression to obtain the facet of the attribute for only the given range. For example: a possible faceted classification for [3, 5] could be ["3": 4, "5": 2, "4": 1].
        Parameters:
        range - the range of values to be present in the facet
        Returns:
        a facet expression for only the given range

      • byRange

        public FacetExpression<T> byRange(java.lang.Iterable<FacetRange<V>> ranges)
        Generates an expression to obtain the facet of the attribute for only the given ranges. For example: a possible faceted classification for [[3, 5], [8, 9]] could be ["3": 4, "9": 3, "5": 2, "4": 1].
        Parameters:
        ranges - the ranges of values to be present in the facet
        Returns:
        a facet expression for only the given ranges

      • byRange

        public FacetExpression<T> byRange(V lowerEndpoint,
                                  V upperEndpoint)
        Generates an expression to obtain the facet of the attribute for only the given range. For example: a possible faceted classification for [3, 5] could be ["3": 4, "5": 2, "4": 1].
        Parameters:
        lowerEndpoint - the lower endpoint of the range of values to be present in the facet, inclusive
        upperEndpoint - the upper endpoint of the range of values to be present in the facet, inclusive
        Returns:
        a facet expression for only the given range

      • byGreaterThanOrEqualTo

        public FacetExpression<T> byGreaterThanOrEqualTo(V value)
        Generates an expression to obtain the facet of the attribute for only values greater than or equal to the given value. For example: a possible faceted classification for [3, +∞) could be ["15": 6, "3": 4, "9": 3, "5": 2, "4": 1].
        Parameters:
        value - the lower endpoint of the range [v, +∞)
        Returns:
        a facet expression for only the given range

      • byLessThan

        public FacetExpression<T> byLessThan(V value)
        Generates an expression to obtain the facet of the attribute for only values less than the given value. For example: a possible faceted classification for (-∞, 5] could be ["3": 4, "1": 3, "5": 2, "4": 1].
        Parameters:
        value - the upper endpoint of the range (-∞, v]
        Returns:
        a facet expression for only the given range
